comments:
I had the same problem twice since I installed 2.1 (2 days...).

In "dialog_settings.xml" and "workbench.xml", after having restarted 
Eclipse, "org.eclipse.team.cvs.*" classes where renamed using 
the "org.eclipse.team.ccvs" package. Eclipse reloaded correcly, but I was not 
able to use CVS and a fatal error occured everytimes I tried to compile a 
class.

I renamed the entries correctly using the "org.eclipse.team.cvs" package and 
everything is working now.

What version were you running before you upgrade? 1.0? 2.0? another?

Did you have any information in your /workspace/.metadata/.log file? I don't 
believe that malformed entries in the workbench.xml and dialog_settings.xml 
files will cause build failures.

When you "renamed the entries" did you rename the projects in your workspace? 
Change the contents of the above-mentioned XML files?

Adding NE to CC for comment re: workbench/dialog XML files.

I didn't upgrade my 2.0.2 installation, I installed it in a new directory.

When I look at the log files, I see a lot of stack traces in relation with CVS.

Sample stack trace:
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-
in: "org.eclipse.core.runtime".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSTeamProvider.<clinit>
(CVSTeamProvider.java:115)

!MESSAGE Error removing nature org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature on project 
jmap30.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Resource is out of sync 
with the file system: /jmap30/.project.

There are also a couple of stack trace coming from the Visual SourceSafe 
plugin I installed yesterday. It may have a relation between this plugin and 
the current problem.
I'm going to uninstall it and see.

I just renamed the entries in both specified files and restarted the 
application.

Workbench.xml contains just the UI layout.  It's possible that if packages have 
been renamed, then certain views/perspectives/actions will not be found when 
you restart, and the workbench layout may have to be reset.  

dialog_settings just contains state like the last filter settings on a view.

Neither should affect the build.

Moving to Platform/VCM for comment.
Have you seen this behaviour before where CVS doesn't want to play nice with 
others?

I don't know what you mean by "In "dialog_settings.xml" and "workbench.xml", 
after having restarted Eclipse, "org.eclipse.team.cvs.*" classes where renamed 
using the "org.eclipse.team.ccvs" package."? Did you modify these files before 
the error occured or did the error occur and then you figured out how to fix it 
by modifying these files?

Also, the log seems to indicate that your .project file is out-of-sync (which 
indicates why you couldn't make the change to the CVS nature). You can fix this 
by refreshing the project. It is odd, however, that you get this error since 
the CVS repository provider doesn't use a nature and hasn't since pre-2.0. I 
suspect that this VSS plugin that you mentioned may have copied code from the 
CVS plugin at that time and didn't properly modify certain properties.

Given the involvement of the VSS plugin, I'm closing this bug. Please reopen if 
you experience problems with the CVS plugin when the VSS plugin is not present. 
You could also check the plugin.xml of the VSS plugin and see if it contains 
the text "org.eclipse.team.cvs.core.cvsnature". If it does, you may want to 
tell the providers of the VSS plugin that they have made a major mistake.

Please reopen if you can reproduce the problem with the VSS plugin removed.
